sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal and State Land Jurisdiction Act of 1991.

sections.heading: Authority to accept retrocession of jurisdiction with respect to
sections.text:
buildings. The Governor is authorized to accept a notice of assignment of
retrocession of jurisdiction from the Administrator of the General Services
Administration under Section 19 of the Public Buildings Act of 1959 (40
U.S.C. 617) with respect to the following buildings: U. S. Customhouse,
610 Canal Street, Chicago, Illinois; Federal Building and Courthouse, 750
Missouri Avenue, East St. Louis, Illinois; Federal Building and U. S.
Courthouse, Monroe, Main, and Hamilton, Peoria, Illinois; Findley Federal
Building, 600 East Monroe Street, Springfield, Illinois; and J. C.
Kluczynski Federal Building and Loop Post Office, 230 South Dearborn
Street, Chicago, Illinois.

sections.heading: Authority to accept retrocession of jurisdiction with respect
sections.text:
to certain land within the United States Army Charles Melvin Price Support
Center.

sections.heading: Cession of concurrent jurisdiction with respect to certain
sections.text: land within the United States Army Charles Melvin Price Support Center.

sections.heading: Authority to accept retrocession of jurisdiction with
sections.text: respect to certain land within the Savanna Army Depot Activity.

sections.heading: Effective date.
sections.text: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
